A

COLLECTION

OF THE

LOCAL AND PERSONAL ACTS,

TO BE JUDICIALLY NOTICED,

PASSED IN THE

Forty-seventh Year

OF THE REIGN OF HIS MAJESTY

KING GEORGE the THIRD,

Sess. 2.

Being the FIRST SESSION of the FOURTH PARLIAMENT of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

LONDON:

Printed by George Eyre and Andrew Strahan. Printers to the King's most Excellent Majesty,

1807.

Cap. i.

An Act for the more speedy and easy Recovery of Small Debts in the Borough and Parish o{ BoJIoti, and the Hundreds of Skirbeck and Kirton (except the Parishes of Gosberton and Surfleet) in the County of Lincoln.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS the Borough of Boston in the County of Lincoln is an ancient Corporation, as well by Prescription as Charter, is a considerable Sea Port and Market Town, having a great and extensive Trade and Commerce carried on therein, and is also much connected in Trade and Business with the several Parishes and Places in the Hundreds of Skirbeck and Kirton aforesaid: And whereas an Act was made in the Twenty-sixth Year of the Reign of his late Majesty King George the Second, intituled, An Act for the more easy and speedy Recovery *6G. 2. c. 7. if Small Debts within the Borough if Bolton and Skirbeck Quarter and the Parishes of Bolton and Skirbek in the County of Lincoln: And whereas another Act was made in the Nineteenth Year of the Reign of His present Majesty, intituled, An Act for the more easy and speedy Recovery of Small Debts within the Soake of Horncaltle, and Wapentakes c/'Wraggoe and Gartree (except the Parish of Great Sturton) and within the Wapentakes Of Louth Like, Ludborough, and Calceworth, end Parishes of Wrangle,

Leake, Lever ten, Benington, Butterwick, I’reilton, and Fishtoft, in the Hundred of Skirbeck, in the County of Lincoln: And whereas it would greatly tend to the Improvement and Encouragement of Trade in the said Borough, and in the said Parishes and Places, and to theneceflary Support and Protection of useful Credit within the same, if the said Act of the Twenty-sixth Year of His late Majesty King George the Second was wholly repealed, and if the said Act of the Nineteenth Year of His present Maly-^- Per.] A 2 jesty.

and the said Commissioners and their Successors are hereby constituted a Court of Justice, by the Name of The Court of Requests for the Borough and Parsi of Boston, and the Hundreds of Skirbeck and Kirton (except the Purifies of Golberton and Surfleet) in the County of Lincoln; and the said Commissioners are hereby empowered and required to meet and act’emble, and to hold the said Court on Monday in every Week in the Guildhall of the said Borough, or in some other convenient Place within the same Borough, to be appointed by the major Part of the said Commissioners for that Purpose assembled; and the first Meeting of the said Commissioners shall be holden on the Third Monday next after the passing of this Act, and the Commissioners present shall elect a Chairman for that Meeting, and so at each succeeding Meeting; and the said Commissioners, or the major Part of them, who shall be present at such Meetings, not being less than Three (except as hereinafter mentioned) are hereby authorized and empowered to hear and determine all such Actions and causes as are herein-after mentioned, and to give such Judgements, and to make such Orders and Decrees therein, and to award Execution thereupon with the Colls, against the Body or Bodies, or against the Goods, of all and every the Person and Persons against whom they shall give any such Judgement, or make any Order or Decree, as to them shall Teem just in Law or Equity; and in case of any Equality of Votes on any Action, Cause, or Question, before the said Commissioners, the said Chairman, so to be elected as aforesaid, shall have the decisive or calling Vote; and if it shall happen that no Chairman shall have been previously elected at that Meeting, then and in every such Case the Commissioner present, who Hands first in the Lift of Names of the said Commissioners, shall have the decisive or calling Vote; and the said Commissioners shall and they are hereby required to hang up, or cause to be hung up, such Lift in the Court or Place where the Commissioners meet.

III. Provided always, and be it enacted, That on the Decision of each and every Action, Cause, or Question, for the Recovery of any Sum not exceeding Forty Shillings, Three at least of the Laid Commissioners shall be present in Court j and on the Decision of each and every Action, Cause, or Question, for the Recovery of any Sum exceeding Forty Shillings, Five at least of the said Commissioners shall be present in Court.

And be it further enacted, That no Person shall be qualified to act as a Commissioner in the Execution of this Act, unless he shall at the Time of acting be a Householder within the Jurisdiction of the said Court, and be possessed of a Real Estate of the annual Value of Fifty Pounds, or of a Personal Estate of the Value of One thousand Pounds above all Charges and Incumbrances whatsoever; and if any Person, not

IX. And for better regulating the Sittings of the said Court, be it further enacted, That the said Commissioners shall not hold the said Court or hear or determine any Case or Cases, Cause or causes, to be heard or determined by the said Commissioners by virtue of this Act but between the Hours of Eight of the Clock in the Forenoon, and Four of the Clock in the Afternoon; and nothing in this Act contained shall extend or he pon ft rued to extend so as to require or compel the Attendance of any Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, Defendant or Defendants, Witness or Witnesses, in the said Court, in pursuance of any Order or Summons issued out of the f, id Court, or by any Person or Persons whomsoever acting as an Officer or Officers of the said Court, save and except between the said Hours of Eight of the Clock in the Forenoon, and Four of the Clock in the Afternoon.

X. And be it further enacted, That it shall and may be lawful to and for the Clerk of the said Court of Requests, from Time to Time, to nominate and appoint a Deputy to act in his room or (lead in case of Sickness, or for other sufficient Cause, to be allowed by the said Mayor and Aldermen for the Time being, or the major Part of them, and such Clerk or his Deputy is and are hereby empowered and required to issue all Summonses, Warrants, and Precepts, and to register all Orders, Decrees, and Judgements of the said Court, and to do all such Acts, Matters, and Things as are directed or required to be done by the said Clerk by virtue of this Act, and shall enter and register, or cause to be entered or registered, in a proper Book or Books to be provided by such Clerk, and kept for that Purpose, all the Acts and Proceedings of the said Court of whatever Nature or Kind soever.

XI. And be it further enacted, That in case of the Neglect or Refusal of the said Commissioners a sufficient Number of the said Commissioners shall not be present to act in the Execution of this Act as is herein directed, on any of the Days appointed for holding of the said Court, then and in every such Case it shall and may be lawful to and for any of the said Commissioners who shall be present, and if no Commissioner shall be present it shall and may be lawful to and for the said Clerk or his Deputy for the Time being, to adjourn the said Court to the next Monday or to some earlier Day.

XII. And be it further enacted, That the Clerk and Crier of the said Court shall and do perform in their respective Offices, as they shall be diiedted or appointed by the said Commissioners; and the several Serjeants of the said Court shall serve all Summonses, and execute such Orders, Warrants, and Precepts, and do and perform all such other Acts, Matters, and Things, as may be required to be done by them respectively by virtue of this Act.

An Act for construcling a Pier and Harbour at or near the Town of Folkestone, in the County of Kent.

[25th July 1 ^07.]

WHEREAS by building a Pier and other necessary Works, a safe and commodious Harbour might be formed at or near the Town of Folkestone, in the County of Kent, which would be of great Benefit and Convenience as well to the Inhabitants of the said Town and its Vicinity, as also to Merchants and all other Persons trading to and from the said Town, or elsewhere in the Channel, by affording Shelter and Protection to Vessels in strong Southerly Winds, and thereby be of great public Utility: And whereas a Survey and Plan have been made by a lkilful and experienced Engineer of the said intended Harbour, and the Estimate for the Formation of the said Pier, and other necessary Works, amounts to the Sum or Twenty one thousand nine hundred and five Pounds: And whereas the Right Honourable 'Jacob Earl of Radnor, as Lord of the Hundred, Barony, or Royalty of Folkestone, is entitled to or qlaims divers Rights and Privileges hereinafter mentioned, which might impede the Scheme of making the said Harbour; but for the Benefit of the Undertaking, and for the Considerations hereinafter mentioned, is minded, for hitoftlf, his Heirs and Assigns, to waive and surrender such Rights and Privileges from the Time the said Harbour shall be completed, for and during such Times hereafter as it shall continue to be used as hereinafter is provided, and to permit certain Rocks, Stones, and other Materials belonging to him and them, to be used in the Construction and Repair thereof: But such beneficial Purposes cannot be carried into Execution without the Aid and Authority of Parl'ament; mav it therefore please Your Majesty [Lqc. is? that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty. by and with the Advice and Conftnt of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the Honourable William Folic-Jlone, commonly called Lord Viscount Foliestone, Sir Henry Oxendon, Baronet, the Mayor of Foliestone for the Time being, the Steward of the Hundred of Foliestone for the time being, Henry Mcckefon, William Maciefon, Henry Major, David Major, Stephen Penfold, and Stephen Penfold junior, together with such other Person or Persons, Body or Bodies Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, as shall at any Time hereafter be possessed of One or more Share or Shares of or in the said Harbour, Pier, Quays, Wharfs, and other Works to be construed and made by virtue of or under the Authority of this Act, and their several and respective Executors, Administrators, Assigns, and Successors, shall be and they are hereby united into and declared to be a Company for the eonflrufting, erecting, building, making, doing, maintaining, repairing, and supporting a Harbour, Pier, Quays, Wharfs, and such other Works, Requisites, Matters, and Things, as shall or may be necessary for the completing of the said Harbour, and the Accommodation of the Vessels lying the rein, and for the other Purposfs of this Act, according to the Directions, and subject to the several Provisoes, Regulations, and Restrictions hereinafter contained; and shall for those i'urposes be one Body Politic and Corporate, by the Name and Style of 41 The Folkestone Harbour Company," and by that Name shall have perpetual Succession and a Common Seal; and by that Name shall and may sue and be sued, and shall and may prefer and prosecute any Bill or Bills of Indictment against any Person or Persons who shall commit any Felony, Misdemeanor, or other Offence indictable by the Laws of this Realm.

II. And be it further enacted, That it shall and may be lawful to and for the said Company of Proprietors, to raise and contribute amongst themselves, a competent Sum of Money for making and maintaining the said Harbour and Pier, and all the Ways, Roads, Quays, Wharfs, and all other Works and Conveniencies belonging or requisite thereto, not exceeding in the whole Twenty-two thousand Pounds (save and except as herein mentioned) and that the same shall be divided into Shares of Fifty Pounds each; and that the said Shares shall be and are hereby vested in the several Persons so subscribing, and their several and respective Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns, to their and every of their proper Use and Benefit, proportionably to the Sums they shall severally raise and contribute; and all Bodies Politic, Corporate, and Collegiate, and all Persons, their several and respective Successors, Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, who shall severally subscribe for One or more Share or Shares, or such Sum or Sums as shall be demanded in lieu thereof, towards carrying on and completing the said Harbour, Pier, Quays, Wharf's, and other Works, and other the Purposes of the said Undertaking, shall be entitled to and receive the entire and Nett Distribution of an equal proportionable Part, according to the Money so by them respectively paid, of the Profits and Advantages that shall and may arise and accrue by the Rates and Duties, and other Sums of Money to be raised, recovered, or received by the said Company of Proprietors, by the Authority of this Act, after

III. And be it further enacted, That the Proprietors of the said Company at their First and every other subsequent Annual Meeting, shall and they are hereby required to name and appoint Two Persons to audit and settle the Accounts of the said Company, jointly with the Steward of the Hundred of Folkestone or his Deputy for the Time being, and that such Two Persons so to be appointed, together with the Steward of the Hundred of Tolkejiant or his 13eputy for the Time being, shall be and are hereby declared to be Auditors for the Purpose of inspecting and auditing the Accounts of the said Directors, and of the several Officers to be appointed under or by virtue of this Act; and that such Accounts so to be allowed, audited, and fttlled by the said Auditors, shall be signed by them, and a Copy thereof shall be, by the Clerk of the said Company, from Time to Time, delivered to the said Earl of Radnor, his Heirs or Assigns, when required by him or them, or on his or their Behalf.

LXIII. And be it further enacted, That in case any Dispute, Suit, or Litigation shall arise, touching or in any wise relating to tire said Rates or Duties, or any of them, the Person or Persons acting by or under the Authority of the said Company or Proprietors, shall not be disqualified from giving Evidence in any such Dispute, Suit, or Litigation, by reason of his, her, or their being appointed to coileft such Rates or Duties.

LXVII. And be it further enacted, That no Action or Suit shall be commenced after Six Calendar Months next after the Cause of Action shall arise, and every such Action or Suit shall be laid or brought in the said Cou ty of Kent, and not elsewhere; and the Defendant or Defendants in all Actions or Suits so brought shall and may plead the General Issue, and give this Act and the special Matter in Evidence at any Trial to be had thereupon, and that the fame was done in pursuance and by the Authority of this Act; and if it shall appear to have been so done, or that such Action or Suit was brought before Sixty Days Notice given to the Defendant or Defendants, or after sufficient Satisfaction made or tendered as aforesaid, or after the Time limited for bringing the same as aforesaid, or shall be brought in any other County than as aforesaid, then and in every such Case, the Jury shall find a Verdict for the Defendant or Defendants; and upon such Verdict, or if the Plaintiff or Plaint.ffs shall be nonsuited, or fuller Discontinuance of his, her, or their Action or Suit, after the Defendant or Defendants shall have appeared, or it upon Demurrer Judgment shall be given against the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, the Defendant or Defendants shall and may recover Treble Costs, and have the like Remedy for the same as any Defendant or Defendants hath or may have for Cods of Suit in any other Cases by Law.

LXVIII. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That nothin? herein contained shall extend, or be construed to extend, to ltffen or abate the Right and Title of the said Earl of Radnor, his Heiis or Assigns, as Lord or Lords of the Barony, Hundred, or Royalty of Folkejione aforesaid, to Customs, Tolls, Rights, Profits of Fairs and Marker, Harbour Duties, and all other Things which shall happen or come within the Jurisdiction of the said Barony, Hundred, or Royalty, or other Benefits or Advantages belonging or in any Way appertaining to the said Earl of Radnor, his Heii s or Assigns, as Lord or Lords of the said Barony, Hundred, or Royalty (other than such Tolls, Rates, and Duties, as are with the Consent of the said Jacob Earl of Radnor, by this Act authorized and directed to be collected, received, and paid for the Use of the Folkijione Harbour Company) or other wise controuled, or intended so to be by this Act; but that he and they may receive and enjoy the same as fully and beneficially, to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever, as if this Act had not been made.

LXIX. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall extend, or be construed to extend to prejudice or derogate from the Estates, Rights, Interests, Privilege or Authority of the King’s most Excellent Majesty, his Ileirs and Successors, or the Lord Warden of the Cinque Ports for the Time being, or any Bodies Politic and Corporate, or other Person or Persons whomfuever, his, her, or their Heirs, Successors, Executors, and Administrators, other than and except those meant and intended to be barred and regulated by this Act.

Cap. 3-

An Act for enlarging the Pcnyers of an Act made in the Thirty-ninth Year of His present Majesty, for amending Two Acts, of the Twenty-eighth and Thirty-eighth Years of His present Majesty, for enlarging and improving the Harbour of Leith; for making certain new Streets and Roads, and widening others, adjacent to and connected with the said Harbour.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS an Act was pa (fed in the Twenty-eighth Year of the Reign of His present Majesty, intituled, An Act for enlarging jjg. 3. c. jS, ami improving the Hat hour of Leith, fr making a new Bason,

Quays, Wharfs, or Do.is, for building Warehouses, for making new Roads

and widening others leading 10 and from the said Harbour, and for impowering

the Lord Prcvoji, Magistrates, and Council of the City of Edinburgh to

purclaje Lands, Houses, and Areas, and to borrow Money for these

Purposes: And whereas an Act was made in the Thirty-eighth Year of the Reign of His present Majesty, intituled, An Act to amend an Act made 33 G. 3. c. 19.

in the Twenty-eighth Year of the Reign of His present Majesty, for enlarging

and improving the Harbour of Lei.h: And whereas an Act was made in

the 1 hirty-ninth Year of the Reign of llis present Majesty, intituled.

An Act to amend Two Acts made in the Twenty eighth and Thirty-eighth 2'ears 3? G. 3. c. 44, of the Reign of His present Majesty, for enlarging and improving the Harbour of Leith: And whereas the Powcis and Authorities granted by the said [Loc. 'df Per.'} £ recited

recited Acts are not sufficient to enable the said Lord Provost, Magistrates, &nd Council, to provide for the Accommodation of the Trade frequenting the Harbour of Leith, by opening certain new Streets and widening others, and it is needfary that the Term and Powers of the said recited Act of the Thirty-ninth Year of the Reign of His present Majesty, fhotil'd be enlarged and amended: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal,.and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the said Lord Provost, Majiltrates, and Council, and their Successors in Office, shall be, and they are hereby authorized and empowered to construct another Drawbridge over the present Harbour of Leith, nearly in a Line with Saint Bernard's Street, and to open a new Street of Sixty Feet wide from the West End of the said Draw-bridge along the South Front of the Warehouses, erected or to be erected on the Land Side of the Wet Dock already constructtd, and of the next Wet Dock to be constructed by the said Lord Provost, Magistrates, and Council, by virtue of the Powers contained in the said recited Act of the Thirty-ninth Year of the Reign of His present Majesty, and to connect the said new Street with the Streers or Roads already made or to be made in the Citadel of Leith, and on the Lands of Hitlhouse Field, and with the Streets or Roads leading to or from Leith Fort; and to trear, contract, and agree with the Owners and Occupiers of Houses, Grounds, and Areas, for the Purchase thereof, to the Extent of One hundred and twenty Feet in Width, in the Line of the said Street, for the Purpose of making the same, and for building on the South Side thereof; reserving always to the said Lord Provost, Magistrates, and Council, ami the Proprietors of Houses, Grounds, and Areas in the Citadel, any Right of Common Property they have or may be found to have in the open Space or Area called The Citadel Green'. Provided always, that the said Owners or Occupiers shall have the Option of building on the South Side of the said Street themselves, or of occupying the fame in any other Way, in place of felling the fame, and which Option they are hereby authorized and required to make within Three Months after the puffing if this Act, by a Writing under their Hands respectively, duly intimated to the Chamberlain of the City of Edinburgh, upon Condition that they oblige themselves severally, that any Buildings to be erected on their respective Properties shall not be of a greater Height than the Warehouses to be erected on the North Side of the said Street, by the said Lord Provost, Magistrates, and Council, and their Successors in Office, and be formed on a regular Plan, to be approved of by the said Lord Provcft, the Lord President of the Court of Session, and the Lord Advocate of Scotland, all for the Time being; provided also, that the said Owners and Occupiers who shall avail themselves of the aforesaid Option, shall form and maintain a good and sufficient Foot Pavement of hewn Free Stones, along the South Side of the said Street, of the Breadth of Nine Feet at leafr, opposite to their respective Properties.

II. And whereas it may happen from the Nature of the Property on the South Side of the said Streer, and of the Plan to be approved of as afore Ltd, that Buildings may require to be erected paaiy on Ground belonging to the said Lord Provost, Magistrates, and Council, and their

Successw*

47° GEORGII III. Sess. 2. Cap. 3. 6$

Successors in Office, and partly on Grounds belonging to other Conterminous Heritors: Be it therefore enacted and declared, That where such Buildings shall be to be erected on the Properties of more than one Conterminous Heritor, the Heritor who shall be Proprietor of the greatest Part of the Property shall have the aforesaid Option, and in calc of his taking the Benefit thereof, shall be bound, and is hereby required to trear, contrail, and agree with the other Conterminous Heritors for the Purchase of the Remainder of such Property, and in the Event of their not being able to agree relative to such Purchase, the Value and Recompence to be paid for the same shall be settled by a Jury, in the Manner herein-after mentioned.

ANNO QUADRAGESIMO SEPTIMO

GEORGII III. REGIS.

Sess. 2.

Cap. 4.

An Act for erecting a County Hall, and other Offices, for the County of Perth.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS the Hall, or Court Room in the City and Royal Burgh of Perth, which is commonly used by the Lords Commissioners of the Court of Judiciary upon the Circuit, by the Freeholders, Justices of the Peace, Commissioners of Supply, and Heritors of the County of Perth, at their general and other Meetings, and also by the Sheriff Depute of the fai I County, and his Substitutes, for the Purpose of administering Justice, and discharging the other Duties of their Offices, is inconveniently situated, too fmali, and altogether incommodious and unsuitable for the i'everal Purposes abovementioned; and it is expedient and necessary to provide a proper Judiciary and County Hall for the Purposes aforesaid: And whereas no pu lie Office, or Place, is at present provided for the Deposit and safe Custody of the Public Records of the County of Perth (excepting such as may happen to be so employed by the Persons for the Time being, holding and exercising the several Offices of Sheriff Clerk, Clerk of the Peace, Clerk of Supply, Clerk of Freeholders, Clerk of Turnpike Roads and Highways, Keeper of the Register of Sa-fmeSjOr other public Offices, within the said County,which Places so employed are private Property, and not secure against Fire or Damp); and it is very important to the Rights and Interests of all Proprietors of Lands in the said County, and other Persons connected therewith, that an Office or Place [Lac. & Per.J X foe

82

Commissioners.

Meetings.

Quorum.

47° GEORGII III. Sess. 2. Cap. 4.

for the Deposit and safe C.ustody of the said Records should be provided and kept within the said City and Royal Burgh of Perth, as being the head Buroh of the County: And whereas no Provisions are contained in any existing Law for determining by what Persons, or out of what Description of Property or Funds, or in what Manner the Expence of building, providing and maintaining such Judiciary and County-Hall is, or ought to be paid; nor is there at present any Fund for building, and providing, and maintaining a public Office, or Place, for the Denofit and late Cudody of the public Records of the said County, all of which Buildings will be of great Benefit, as well to the County of Perth at large, as to the City and Royal Burgh of Perth. May it therefore please your Majesty, That it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the Justices of the Peace and Commissioners of Supply of the County of Perth, being in the actual Pafledion of the Property or Dominium utile of Lands, valued in the Cess-Books of the said County, at One Hundred Pounds Scots of valued Rent; the Sheriff-Depute of the County of Perth and his Suboitutes, and the chief Magistrates of the City and Royal Burgh of Perth, and of the Royal Burgh of Culrofs, all for the Time being shall be, and they are hereby nominated and appointed Commissioners for building, altering, enlarging, improving, furnishing, repairing, and keeping in Repair, the Hall, Offices, and Places before-mentioned, for making Avenues to the fame, and for executing all the other Powers by this Act committed to the said Commissioners.

II. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners shall hold Two dated Meetings at Perth every Year, One on the same Day on which the Commissioners of Supply of the said County of Perth diall meet for the Purpose of assessing the Land Tax on the said County, and the 6ther upon the Day of the Michaelmas Meeting of Freeholders of the said County, and shall hold their Fird Meeting on the Fourth Monday after the passing of this Act; of which Fird Meeting the Sheriff-Clerk of the said Counry is hereby directed and required to give Nonce by Advertisement in any Two Newspapers usually circulated through the said County, at lead Ten Days before the Day of such Meeting; and the Sheriff-Clerk shall have Power, and he is hereby ordered and required, when directed (by a Writing under the Hands of any Three or more. Commissioners), to call at any Time an extraordinary Meeting of Commissioners, to be held at Perth, giving the like previous Notice of the Time, and also Notice of the Purpose of the Meeting; and at such Meeting no Business diall be entered or decided upon, other than what shall be specified in the Notice given as aforesaid; and it shall not be in the Power of any ordinary or extraordinary Meeting, to refeind, alter, or vary the Determination of any former ordinary or extraordinary Meeting, unless previous Notice of the Intention of so doing, and the Time of the Meeting, be given by Advertisements in the Newspa pers as aforesaid.

III. And be it enacted, That at all ordinary and extraordinary Meetings of the said Commissioners, any Fifteen of them shall be a Quorum, who shall have Power to adjourn to any future Day; and if a Quorum of Commis-

4 Loners

83

47° GEORGII III. Self. 2. Cup. 4.

sioners shall not be present, any one or more Commissioners present shall have Power to adjourn, but not to do auy other Business.

IV. And be it enacted, That if any Person (other than those herein before-named Commissioners by virtue of their Offices), not qualified as aforesaid shall, notwithstanding, presume to act as a Commissioner, in the Execution of this Act, every fuel) Person shall, for every such Offence, forfeit and pay any Sum r. it exceeding Fifty Pounds, hefides the Expence of Prosecution, to be levied by summary Complaint of any One of the said Comtnif sioners before the Justices of the Peace for the County of Perth, at their Quarter Sessions, or before the Sheriff’-Depute, or Substitute of the said County, to be paid to the said Commissioners, or their Treasurer, to be applied to the Purposes of this Act; and the Proof of Qualification shall he upon the Person complained of.

V. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners, at their Firff, or any subsequent Meeting, shall, by a Plurality of Voices, elect a Praefes, and appoint a Clerk and Treasurer, to hold and exercise these Offices, at the Will and Pleasureof the said Commissioners, either separately or jointly, with reasonable Salaries, or other Allowances for their Trouble; and such Clerk and Treasurer shall find Security for the due Execution of their Offices, and shall at all Times obey the lawful Commands and Instructions of the said Commissioners.

VI. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners may, if they shall think fit, appoint a Committee or Committees of their Nuniberto luperintend the Progress of the Buildings to be erected, or to carry into effect any of the Purposes of this Act, to whom they mav delegate iueh of the Powers hereby granted to the said Commissioners as they shall think fit.

VII. X. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners shall have Power and Authority to employ and contract with Artirts, Tradesmen, and other Persons for making Plans of, and for erecting the said Hall, Offices, and Places, and to direct Alterations and Improvements thereon, at all Times, during the Execution of the Work, and to do whatever may be necessary, proper, and expedient for carrying the Purposes of this Act completely into Effect, and to purchase suitable Furniture for the said Hall, Offices, and Places, when the same are completed.

XI. XII. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners may sue and be sued for any Matter or Thing to be done in the Execution of this Act in the Name of their Clerk or Treasurerfor the Time being, and that no Action or Suit wherein the said Commissioners shall be concerned as Pursuers or Defenders in the name of their Clerk or Treasurer by virtue of this Act shall abate by the Death or Removal of any such Clerk or Treasurer, but that the Clerk or Treasurer to the said Commissioners for the Time being shall be deemed to be the Pursuer or Defender (as the Case may be), in every such Action; and that the said Commissioners shall be intitled to acquire all Rights of Property and Servitude connected with the said Buildings, Hall, Offices, and Places, and the Site or Area thereof, and Avenues leading to the fame, and that the Rights and Conveyances thereof to the said Commissioners shall be taken in favour of their Clerk or Treasurer for the Time being, and his Successors in Office, which Rights and Conveyances so taken shall be sufficient for vesting the Subjects thereby conveyed in the said Commissioners.

Provided also, and be it further enacted, That where by reason of any Disability or Incapacity of the Person or Persons, or Corporation, entitled to any Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments to be purchased under the Authority of this and the said recited Act, the Purchase Money for the same shall be required to be paid into the said Court, and to be applied in the Purchase of other Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments to be settled to the like Uses in pursuance thereof respectively, it shall be lawful for the said Court to order the Expences of all Purchases from Time to Time to be made in pursuance of this Act, or so much of such Expences as the Court shall deem reasonable, together with the necessary Colls and Charges of obtaining such Order, to be paid by the said Commissioners, or any Five or more of them, who shall from Time to Time pay such Sums of Money for such Purposes as the said Court shall direct.

XVI. And be it further enacted, That this Act shall be deemed and taken to be a Publick Act, and shall be judicially taken Notice of as such by 311 Judges, Judites, and others, without being specially pleaded.

Cap. 7.

An Act for the more easy and speedy Recovery of Small Debts, within the Parishes of Saint John the Baptist, Saint Peter the Apostle, and Birching-tony and the Vill of Wood, in the IJJe of Thdnet, and County of Kent.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS the Inhabitants of the Town of Margate and of the Parishes of Saint John the Baptist, Saint Piter the Jpofile, Birthington, and the Vill ot Wood, in the Me of Thanet, in the County of Kent, within the Liberty of the Town and Port Of Dover in the same County, have of late Years very much increased in Number, and during certain Parts of the Year many Persons resort to the said Town of Margate in the said Parish of Saint "John the Baptist, and also to the Hamlet of Broadjlairs in the said Parish of Saint Peter the dpojlle, from all Parts of the United Kingdom; and a great and extensive Trade is also carried on within the Parishes and Vill aforesaid: And whereas many Persons within the Parishes and Vill before mentioned, contract Small Debts and (although ableJ are unwilling and refute to pay the fame, ptefuming on the Inconvenience which Creditors lie under from the Expence they are unavoidably put to, and the Delays which they meet with in luing for such Debts in Courts of Law: And whereas if a more speedy Method for the Recovery of Small Debts noc exceeding Five Pounds, within the Parishes and Vill aforesaid, weie established, it would tend to the Support of useful Credit within the same Parishes and Vill, and would in various other Respects [Lee. & Per. And be it further enacted, That where any Debt shall be due and owing, or demanded from any Two or more Persons jointly, by reason or on account of such Persons being Partners in Trade, or otherwise jointly concerned, Service of such Summons as aforesaid on any One of such Partners or Persons, or left at his, her, or their lad usual Place or Plates of Abode, Warehouse, Lodging, Shop, Shed, Stall, Stand, or other Place of dealing, trading, or working, shall be as good and sufficient as if each of futh Partners or Persons were separately summoned as afi rtsaid.

XLVIII.And, for removing all Doubts whether the Statute of Limitations may be pleaded in the said Court of Requeds, it is hereby further enacted and declared, That all Defendants in the said Court shall be allowed to plead or claim the Benefit of any Statute of Limitation in force and effect; and every Defendant so pleading or claiming, shall have and receive such and the like Advantage and Relief thereby, as such Defend, ar.t would have been entitled to in case this Act had not been made, and he, she, or they had been (ued for the fame Debt or other Cause of Action in any of His Majrdy’s Courts of Record at Westminster, or any other Court, and had there pleaded such Statute in bar to the Action or Suit.

ANNO QUADRAGESIMO SEPTIMO

GEORGII III. REGIS.

Cap. 8.

An Act to amend and enlarge the Powers of an Act, passed in the Ninth Year of His present Majesty, for the better paving, cleansing, lighting, and watching the Streets and Lanes in the Pavifh and Borough of New Windsor, in the County of berks; and for preventing Nuisances therein.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Ninth Year of the Reign of

His present Majesty, intituled, An Act for the better paving, 9 G 3. c. 10, cleansing, lighting, and watching the Streets and Lanes in the Parish and Borough of New Windsor, in the County of Berks; and for preventing Nuisances and Annoyances therein: And whereas the Pow ers and Provisions of the said recited Act have, in some respects, been found defective and insufficient for the good Purposes thereby intended, and it is found expedient that the said Act should be altered, explained, and amended, and the Powers and Provisions thereof enlarged: May it therefore please ILoc. & Per,] L 1 Your

IV. And be it further enacted, That if any Person shall empty any Privy, Necessary house, or Cefspool, or carry any Night Soil along any of the Streets, Lanes, or other publick Passages or Places within the said Parish and Borough, before the Hour of Twelve of the Clock at Night, or after Four of the Clock in the next Morning, in any Part of the Year, or put or cast any Night Soil in or over any of the said Streets, Lanes, or other publick Passages or Places, or in any respect improperly, carelessly, or negligently remove the fame, every Person so offending shall for every such Offence forfeit and pay any Sum not exceeding Five Pounds.

V. And be it further enacted, That all and every Person and Persons inhabiting any House or other Building within the said Parish and Borough of New Windsor, shall, from and after the Second Monday next after the passing of this Act, sweep and cleanse, or cause to be swept and cleansed, the Foot Pavement before their respective Houses, Buildings, and Walls, on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday in every Week, before Ten of the Clock in the Morning, or oftener if thereto required by the said Commissioners, or any Five or more of them, or their Surveyor or Surveyors for the Time being, upon Pain of forfeiting any Sum not exceeding One Shilling for every Neglect therein.

VI. And be it further enacted, That every Person, being Landlord or Tenant, who shall let his or her House in separate Apartments or ready fumished to a Lodger or Lodgers, for any less Term than a Year, shall, for the several Purposes of this Act, be deemed and taken to be the Occupier thereof, and may be rated and assessed accordingly.

VII. And be it further enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said

Commissioners, or any Five or more of them, from Time to Time, as they shall think proper, to compound with any of the Inhabitants of any of the said Streets and Lanes within the said Parish and Borough, by the Year or otherwise, for such Sum or Sums of Money as they shall think proper, for the sweeping and cleansing to be done by such Inhabitants respectively, before their respective Houses or Tenements, by virtue of this Act, provided such Composition Money be always paid in advance.

Cap. io.

An Act for making and maintaining a Road from

Birmingham, in the County of Warwick, to join the Lichfield Turnpike Road, in the Parish of Shenficr.e, in the County of Stafford, and for making a Branch of Road to communicate therewith.

[25th July 1807.]

ind

mi all/

N.

WHEREAS the Road leading from Birmingham through Part of the Parish of Sutton Coldfield, both in the County of Warwick, into the Turnpike Road leading from the City of Lichfield, into or through the Parish of Shenstone, in the County of Stafford, and also the Road leading out of the said first mentioned Road beyond the Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield into the 'turnpike Road leading from the Borough cf Tamworth to the said Town of Sutton Coldfield, are very much out of Repair, narrow, and incommodious for Travellers, and some Parts thereof are in so ruinous a Condition as to be unsafe for the Passage of Cattle and Carriages; and the said Roads cannot be sufficiently amended, widened, altered, and kept in Repair by the ordinary course of Law; may it therefore please your Majesty, that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That Charles Bowyer Adder ley, Trustee*. VI. And be it further enacted, That the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, shall and may from Time to Time, at any of their Meetings to beholden in pursuance of this Act, appoint a Treasurer or Cashier, and a Clerk or Clerks, and also such Collector or Collectors of the Tolls, Surveyors cf Roads and Buildings, and other Officers, with such Salaries or Allowances as they shall think necessary, and shall and may from Time to Time remove any such Officers as they shall see Occasion; and in case of Removal, or of the Death or Resignation of any such Officers, shall and may appoint new ones in their Stead: Provided nevertheless, that whenever any Collector of the Tolls, to be appointed by virtue of this Act, shall die, resign, or become incapable of performing his Duty, it shall be lawful for any Five or more of the said TrusteeSj although not assembled at a Meeting, by Writing under their Hands, to appoint another Person to supply his Place, until the next Meeting of the Trustees, at which Time such Order shall be made for his Continuance or for his Removal, and for the Appointment of another in his Stead, as shall feetn adviseable; any Thing hereir.-before contained to the contrary notwithstanding.

and in case any Money so received by any such Officer or Person as last mentioned shall thereupon be found to remain in his or their Hands the same shall be paid to the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, or to such Person or Persons as they shall by Writing under their Hands authorize or empower to receive the same, and shall be disbursed and laid out in the Execution cf this Act, and not otherwise; XIV. And it is hereby further enacted and declared, That no Person shall be liable to pay more than once for passing or repairing at any Time or Times in any one Day (to be computed from Twdve of the Clock at Night to Twelve of the Clock in the succeeding Night) with the fame Horles, Cattle, or Carriages respectively, through all or any of the Toll Gates to be erected by virtue of this Act, but that every Person, after having paid Toll once, and producing a Note or Ticket denoting such Payment, shall afterwards be permitted to pass with every such Horse, Cattle, or Carriage, Toil-free, during such Day, through all or any of the said Toll Gates; which Note or Ticket the Collectors of the Tolls are hereby required to give gratis on Receipt of the Toll.

XV. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That if any Dispute shall happen touching the Quantity of Tolls due, or the Charges of taking, keeping, or felling any Distress, which shall be taken by virtue of this Act, it shall and may be lawful for the Collector or Person distraining to retain the Distress, or the Money arising from the Sale thereof, until the Quantity of such Tolls, or the Charges of seizing, detaining, and disposing of such Distress as aforesaid (as the Case shall happen) shall be ascertained by some Justice of the Peace for the County, Place, or District where such Dispute shall arise, who, upon Application made to him for that Purpose, shall examine the Matter upon Oath of the Parties, or any Witness or Witnesses (which Oath such Justice is hereby empowered to administer) and shall determine the Quantity of the Toll due, and also assess the Costs and Charges of such Seizure, Distress, Keeping, and Sale, and all other reasonable Costs and Charges; all which Sum or Sums of Money, so determined and assessed, shall be paid to the Collector before he shall be obliged to return the Distress or the Overplus after the Sale thereof, or of any Part thereof.

Provided always, and be it further enacted, That if any Person shall think himself or herself aggrieved by any Thing done in pursuance of this Act, and for which no Method of Relief hath been already appointed, such Person may appeal to the Justices of the Peace at any General Quarter Sessions of the Peace to be holden for the said County of Warwick, within Four Calendar Months next after the Cause of such Complaint shall have arisen, such Appellant full: giving or causing to be given Eight Days Notice at least in Writing of his or her Intention to bring such Appeal, and of the Matter thereof, to the Clerk or Treasurer to the said Trustees, and within Four Days after such Notice entering into a Recognizance belore a Justice of the Peace for such County or Place, with Two sufficient Sureties conditioned to try such Appeal, and abide the Order thereon, and to pay such Colls as shall be awarded by the Justices at such Quarter Sessions; and the said Justices at such Sessions, upon due Proof of such Notice being given as aforesaid, and of entering into tuch Recognizance, shall hear and fit. ally determine the Cause and Matter of such Appeal in a summary Way, and award such Colls to the Parties appealing or appealed against as they the said Justices shall think proper; and the Determination of such Quarter Sessions shall be final, binding, and conclusive, to all Intents and Purposes j and the said Justices at such Sessions may also, by their Order or Warrant, levy such Colts so awarded, by Distress and Sale of the Goods and Chattels of the Person or Persons who shall refuse or neglect to pay the fame; and for want of sufficient Distress commit such Person or Persons to the Gaol or House of Correction for the ft id County of Warwick, for any Time not exceeding Three Calendar Months, or until Payment of such Cost=.

LVI. And be it further enacted, That this Act shall be deemed and taken to be a Publick Act, and shall be judicially taken Notice of as such by all Judges, Justices, and others, without being specially pleaded.

Commencement and Continuance of this Act.

LVII. And be it further enacted, That this Act shall commence and take place upon the Day of the passing thereof, and shall be in force and have Continuance for and during the Term of Twenty-one Years, and from thence to the End of the then next Session of Parliament.

Cap. 11.

An Act for repairing and maintaining certain Roads in the County of Dumbarton, and building Bridges thereon.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS the Roads from the West End of the 'Bndgeof Dumbarton, leading into the County of Argyle, and the western Highlands and Wands of Scotland are very incommodious, and cannot be effectually repaired, amended, enlarged, and made paffaBle, and the Bridges thereon, or which may be necessary over the River Liven, in the said County, to communicate therewith, cannot be built arid kept in good Repair, according to the ordinary Course and Method appointed by the Laws and Statutes of this Realm: May it therefore please your Majesty, That it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons in this Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That every Person who is or shall be in his own Right or in the Right of his Wife, in the actual Possession and Enjoyment of the Life-rent or Fee of the Dominium Utile of Lands lying in the Parishes through which the said Roads shall pass, and valued in the Tax Rolls of the County, to the extent of One Hundred Pounds Scots, per Annum; and the Eldest Son of such Person, being the Heir Apparent to such Property, in the Absence of his Father, the Member of Parliament for the County for the Time being, and the Provost of the Town of Dumbarton for the Time being; and every Justice of the Peace for the said County, residing in the Parishes through which the said Roads shall pass, shall be, and they are hereby nominated and appointed Trustees, for the surveying, altering, making, maintaining, repairing, and keeping in Repair the said several Roads and Bridges leading from the welt End of the Bridge of Dumbarton along the River Clyde, Gareloch, and Lochlong, to a Place called New Tarbet, and from the said weft End of the said Bridge of Dumbarton along the River Leven, and a Part of Lochlomond, to the School House at ILoc. if Per.] 3 B Lufs,

II. Provided always, That if any Person not qualified as aforesaid, shall presume to act as aTrustee, contrary to the Intent and Meaning of this Act, every Person so presuming to act shall, for every such Offence, forfeit and lose the Sum of Twenty Pounds Sterling, to be recovered and applied as herein-after directed, and the Proof of Qualification shall lie upon the Person complained of.

III. And be it enacted, That Three of the said Trustees shall be a Quorum, and that any Three or more of them, being duly assembled, shall be held to constitute a General Meeting.

IV. And be it enacted, That the said Trustees shall meet in Dumbarton, on the First Tuesday of August One thousand eight hundred and seven, or as soon after the said Day as conveniently maybe, and thereafter yearly upon the Bird Tuesday of June, for the Purpose of putting this Act into Execution; and may at-such Meetings, and from Time to Time afterwards, adjourn themselves to such Times and Places as the said Trustees, at such lad Meeting, diall think proper, without Prejudice to their Meeting sooner, if there shall be Occasion, upon Notice by any Three of their Number, or by the Clerk or Clerks to the said Trustees, advertised in one Glasgow Newspaper, or Dumbarton Newspaper, when there shall be one, Fourteen Days at lead before the Day of such Meeting, for the Purpose of putting this Act into Execution; and at all Meetings held under this Act, the Trustees shall defray their own Expences.

V. And be it further enacted, That no Determination of the said Trustees, at any annual General Meeting assembled, shall be annulled, varied, or altered, by any subsequent adjourned Meeting or Meetings called by Advertisement as aforesaid, unless such subsequent General Meeting shall be called by Advertisement as aforesaid, Fourteen Days previous to the Meeting, at the Desire and subscribed Requisition of not less than Three in Number of the said Trustees, and unless such Summons shall contain a Specification of such former Resolution of the Trustees therein proposed to be brought under Review, and unless a Majority of such Trustees at such Meeting so to be called shall agree to annul, vary, or alter, such Determination.

And be it further enacted, That when the said Truflegs shall have taken, or resolved to take into their Possession any Lands, Tenements, Houses, or Heritages, for the Purpose of the said Roads, or for the Purpose ofereftingToIl-houses, Steel-yards, or weighing Machines thereon, or have resolved to build a Bridge or Bridges across the River Leven or otherwise, by which the Owners of Lands or Ferries, or other Persons interested therein, may suffer Damage, the said Trustees shall be obliged to satisfy and pay the Proprietors, or Owners, and Occupiers, and other Persons interested in such Lands, Tenements, Houses or Heritages and Ferries, the Value thereof, and of the Damages done, as can be agreed upon between the said Trustees and such Proprietor or Proprietors, Occupier or Occupiers and other Per-fens interested therein, and in the event that they cannot agree, then the said Trustees shall be obliged to pay such Sum or Sums of Money, as shall be awarded by a Jury of Fifteen Persons summoned and chol'en by the Sheriff Depute of the County of Dumbarton, in such Manner as Juries are summoned and chosen by Sheriffs of Counties in Scotland, whole Determina tion is hereby declared to be final, without being subject to Advocation, Suspension, or Reduction, and the Sheriff Depute or his Substitute, upon the Petition of either Party, setting forth the Circumstances of the Cafe, is hereby required within a reasonable Time thereafter, to summon and choose such Jury, and in the event that such Jury shall award a greater Compensation than the Trustees shall have offered, but less than the Owner or Owners, Occupier or Occupiers shall have required, the Expence of such Jury shall be defrayed and borne by the said Trustees, and the said Owner and Owners, Occupier or Occupiers equally; but in Case the said Jury shall award to such Owner or Owners, Occupier or Occupiers, the Sum l'o required, or any greater Sum, the Whole of the said Expence shall bepaidby the said Trustees; and on the other Hand, if the said jury shall award the Sum offered by the said Trustees, or a less Sum,the whole of the said Expence shall bepaid by the said Owner or Owners, OccupierorOccupiers: Provided always that in all Cales, when any Person or Persons shall, byReafon of Absence, be prevented from treating with the said Trustees, such Colls and Expences shall be borne and paid by the said Trustees.

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That w'herethe Ground on the Sides of the aforesaid Roads is or shall be planted with Trees, or is or shall be inclosed by Hedges, the Proprietors or Occupiers of such Ground on each Side of the said Roads shall, at a proper Season of the Year, lop and prune the Trees, and cut and dress the Hedges in such Manner, that no Part of the said Trees shall overhang any part of the said Roads, nor the Hedges be allowed to grow higher than Four Feet from the Surface of the Ground at the bottom of the Hedge; and in rafe he, she, or they neglect so to do, after being required by an Order from any Two or more of the said Trustees, the said Trustees, or their Surveyor, shall cause the same to be done, and levy the Expence thereof from the Proprietors or Occupiers of the said Grc - nd.

with sufficient Stones, in such Manner as the Course of the Water in the Drains may not be interrupted, or the Roads thereby prejudiced: Provided always, that no Occupier of Lands shall turn any Water upon the Sides of the said Roads, nor conduct any Water across the said Roads for meliorating of his Fields, or other Purposes, until he shall have applied for and obtained the Consent of Three or more of the said Trustees; and every such Occupier shall be obliged to carry the Water across the Road in a covered Drain, of such Depth and Conflruflion as that the Water may not prejudice the Road; and every Person offending in any of the above Particulars, and being convicted thereof as aforesaid, before any Two or more Justices of the Peace of the said County, or where the Offender shall be or reside, shall, for every such Offence, forfeit and pay a Sum not exceeding Twenty Shillings Sterling.

and in case such Appeal shall be disallowed, the Appellant shall pay such Costs and Charges as the said Justices shall direct in that Behalf; and every such Appeal shall, at the said Quarter Sessions be heard and finally determined, without being subject to Advocation, Suf-pension or Reduction.

Cap. 13.

An Act for making and maintaining Roads from Percy's Cross to Milfield Burn, and from Wooler to Boivjdon Burn, in the County of Northumberland.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS the Road leading from the North End of Breamiji.i Turnpike Road, at or near Percy's Cross, to Milfield Burn, where the fame joins the ford Turnpike Road, and also the Road from the Town of Wooler towards Berwick, where the fame joins the Turnpike Road in the County of Durham, at or near Bowfdon Burn, are very much out of Repair, narrow, and incommodious, and cannot be sufficiently amended, widened, improved, and kept in Repair by the ordinary Course of Law, without the Aid and Authority of Parliament; may it therefore please Your Majesty, That it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That James Trusteee. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That no Person shall be capable of acting as a Trustee in the Execution of this Act, unless he shall be in his own Right, or in the Right of his Wife, in the actual Pof-or Receipt of the Rents and Profits of Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments, of the clear yearly Value of One hundred Pounds above Reprizes, or shall be Heir apparent of a Person possessed of an Estate in such Lands, Tenements or Hereditaments, of the clear yearly Value of Two hundred Pounds above Reprizes, or shall be possessed of or entitled to a Personal Estate of Three thousand Pounds, nor (except in administering tire Oath herein-after mentioned) until he shall have taken and subscribed. before any Two or more of the said Trustees, an Oath, in the Words or to the Effect following; (that is to say),

and such Collectors, Clerks, Treasurers, Surveyors, or other Officers, or any of them, from Time to Time to remove, and to appoint others in the Room of such of them as shall be so removed, or shall die, or become incapable of performing their Duty, and may and are hereby authorized and empowered, out of any of the said Monies arising by virtue of this Act, to allow and pay to the several Collectors, Clerks, Treasurers, Surveyors, and other Officers, and to such other Person or Persons as shall be assisting to them or any of them in or about the Execution of this Act, such Salaries, Rewards, and Allowances for their Attendance, Care, and Service, as to the said Trustees or any Three or more of them shall seem reasonable; and all such Officers and Persons shall from Time to rl'ime, when thereunto required by the said Trustees or any Three or more of them, deliver to such Trustees or any Three or more of them, or to such Person or Persons as they or any Three or more of them shall for that Purpose appoint, true and perfect Accounts in Writing under their respective Hands, upon Oath (which Oath the said Trustees, or any Two or more of them, are hereby empowered to administer) of all Monies which he, they, and every of them, shall have respectively received to that Time, by virtue of this Act, and how much thereof hath been paid and difbuvfed, and for what Purposes, together with the proper Vouchers for such Payment; XII. XV. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That no Person or Persons shall be chargeable with or liable to pay any of the Tolls aforesaid, for any Horses, Cattle, or Carriages whatsoever, or for any Oxen, Cows, or Neat Cattle, Calves, Hogs, Goats, Sheep, or Lambs respectively, both at the Toll Gate or Turnpike to be hereafter erected on that Part of the said Road lying on or to the South of Wooler Bridge, and the Toll Gate or Turnpike to be hereafter erected on that Part of the said Road lying on or to the North of Wooler Bridge, on the same Day, but only at such One of them as shall be first parted; and that all and every Person and Persons who shall have paid Toll at either of the said Gates or Turnpikes, and who shall produce a Ticket or Tickets denoting the Payment thereof, shall be allowed to pass and repass with the fame Horses, Cattle, Beads, and Carriages, Toll-free, during such Day, through the other of the said Gate* or Turnpikes; and every Collector of the Tolls, on the Receipt of the Toll, shall on Demand thereof made by any Person or Persons paying such Toll, deliver a Note or Ticket gratis, denoting such Payment.

XVI. And be it further enacted, That if any Dispute shall happen about the Amount of Tolls due, or the Charges of keeping any Distress., it shall be lawful for the Collector or Person so distraining to retain such Distress, or the Money arising from the Sale thereof (as the Case may happen, until the Amount of the Tolls due, and the Charges of the Dit tress and Sale, and of keeping the Distress (as the Case may happen) shall be ascertained by some Justice of the Peace for the County, Riding, or Place in which the Cause of Dispute shall arise, who, upon Application made to him for that Purpose, shall examine the Matter on the Oath of the Parties or other Witness or Witnesses, and shall determine the Amoiint of the Tolls due, and also assess the Charges of such Distress and Sale, and of the Collector’s Attendance for that Purpose upon the said Justice; all which Sums so determined or assessed, shall be paid to the said Collector before he shall be obliged to return the said Distress, or the Overplus after Sale thereof, or any Part thereof.

XVII. And be it further enacted, That in Cafe any Dispute, Suit, or Litigation shall arise touching or in anywise relating to the said Tolls, the Person or Persons appointed to collect the fame, or any other Person or Persons acting by or under the Authority of the said Trustees, shall not be incompetent to give Evidence in any such Dispute, Suit, or Litigation, by reason of his, her, or their being so appointed to collect the said Tolls, Qt acting under the Authority of the said Trustees.

every Person so offending in any of the Cases aforesaid, shall for every such Offence forfeit and pay the Sum of Fifty Shillings, One Moiety whereof shall be paid to the Informer or Informers, and the other Moiety shall be applied towards the Purposes of this Act.

XLVI. And be it further enacted, That the said Trustees or any Five to ba erected, or more of them, shall and are hereby empowered and required to cause the said Roads to be meaftired, and Mi e Stones or Polls to be fel up on the Sides of the said Roads, with Inscriptions thereon, denoting the Number of Miles and Distances of Places, and also Direction Polls at the several Roads leading out of the said Roads hereby directed to be repaired, with Inscriptions thereon, denoting to what Place or Places the said Roads respectively lead, as they or any Five or tnore of them strall think fit; and if any Person or Persons shall wilfully break down, dig up, injure, or destroy any of the said Stones or Poits which shall be so fixed or set up, or erase, obliterate, or deface any of the Inscriptions or Letters which shall be engraven or made thereon, or on any Part thereof; or cause or procure the same to be done, every such Person so offending shall forfeit and pay any Sum not exceeding Five Pounds for each Stone or Poll so wilfully or' designedly broken, obliterated, defaced, injured, or pulled ' down, to be levied by Distress and Sale of the Goods and Chattels of Inch Offenders, by Warrant under the Hand and Seal or Hands and Seals of One or more Justice or Justices of the Peace of the said County of Nor- ihumberland, before whom such Conviction shall be made, One Moiety of such Forfeiture shall go to the Informer, and the other Moiety shall be laid out and employed in repairing the Stones or Posts so broken, pulled down, obliterated, defaced, or injured, or in supplying new ones in their (lead, and if there shall be an Overplus, the same shall be laid out in repairing the said Roads; and in case the said Penalty shall not be forthwith paid upon Conviction of the Offender or Offenders, that then it shall be lawful for any One or more Justice or Justices of the Peace for the said County, by Warrant under his or their Hand and Seal or Hands and Seals, to commit such Person or Persons to the House of Correction of the said County, there to remain without Bail or Mainprize for any Term not exceeding One Calendar Month, or until the said Penalty, with the Charges of such Commitment, shall be paid.

LI. And be it further enacted, That the said Trustees or any Three or more of them, or such Person or Persons as they shall for that Purpose authorize, delegate, or appoint, are hereby empowered to contract with any Person or Persons for making, altering, raising, widening, or repairing the said Roads or any Part thereof, or for doing any other Works to be performed in the Execution of this AT, in such Manner, or for such Sum or Sums of Money, as the said Trustees or any Three or mere of them shall think proper.

LII. And be it further enacted, That all Contracts in Writing entered into, pursuant to an Order made at any Meeting by the said Trustees or any Three or more of them, shall be binding to all the Parties who shall sign the fame, his, her, and their Executors and Administrators; and that Actions and Suits may be maintained thereon, and Damages and Colts recovered against the Parties failing in the Execution thereof.

LIII. And be it further enacted, That where any Distress shall be made for any Sum or Sums of Money to be levied by virtue of this Act, the Distress itself shall not be deemed unlawful, nor the Party or Parties making the same be deemed a Trespasser or Trespassers on Account of any Defect or Want of Fomi in the Summons, Conviction, Notice, Warrant of Distress, or other Proceedings relative thereto; nor shall the Party or Parties distraining be deemed a Trespaifer or Trespassers, ab initio, on Account of any Irregularity which shall be afterwards done by the Party or Parties-distraining, but the Person or Persons aggrieved by such Irregularity may recover Satisfaction for the special Damages in an Action on the Cafe.

LIV. And be it further enacted, That no Proceedings to be had touching the Conviction of any Offender or Offenders against this Act, or any Order made, or other Matter or Thing to be dune or transaded in or relating to the Execution of this Act, shall be quaffed for Want of Form, or be liable io be removed by Certiorari, or any Writ or Process whatsoever, into any other of His Majesty's Courts of Record at Westminster or elsewhere, any Law or Statute to the contrary notwithstanding.

And be it further enacted, That all Orders and Proceedings of the said Trustees in the Execution of the Powers hereby to them given, shall from Time to Time be entered in a Book or Books to be kept 1 or that Puri pose, and such Orders and Proceedings so entered shall be signed by the lame Number of the said Trustees as, are in and by this Act empowered to make or direct such Orders and proceedings respectively, and shall be deemed and taken to be original Owners; which said Book or Books, and also the Book directed to be kept for registering the _ said Mortgages and Assignments or Transfers, shall and may be produced and read in Evidence in all Courts whatsoever.;

LIX. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That no Action or Suit shall be commenced against any Person or Persons for any Thing done in pursuance of this Act, until Ten Days Notice thereof shall be given to the Clerk or Clerks of the said Trustees, or after a sufficient Satisfaction, or a Tender thereof, hath been made to the Party or Parties aggrieved, or after Six Calendar Months next after the Fact committed, and every such Action or Suit shall be laid or brought in the County of Northumberland, and not elsewhere; and the Defendant or Defendants in every such Action shall and may, at his or their Election, plead specially or the General I flue. Not Guilty, and give this Act and the special Matter in Evidence at any Trial to be had thereupon, and that the fame was done in pursuance and by the Authority of this Act; and if the same shall appear to have been so done, or that such Addon or Suit shall have been brought before Ten Days Notice thereof was given as aforesaid, or after a sufficient Satisfaction made or tendered as aforesaid, or after the Time limited for bringing the same as aforesaid, or shall be brought in any other County, then the Jury shall find for the Defendant or Defendants; and upon such Verdict, or if the Plaintiff' or Plaintiffs shall be nonsuited, or discontinue, his, her, or their Addon or Suit, after the Defendant or Defendants shall have appeared, or if upon Demurrer Judgment shall be given against the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, then the Defendant or Defendants shall recover Treble Costs, and shall have such Remedy for the fame, as any Defendant or Defendants hath or have in other Cases by Law.

LX. And be it Farther enacted, That this Act shall be deemed and taken to be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken Notice of as such by all Judges, Juffiees, and others, without being specially pleaded.

LXI. And be it further enacted, That this Act shall commence and take Effect on the passing thereof; and shall be in Force and have Continuance for and during the Term of Twenty-one Years, and from thence to the End of the then next Session of Parliament.

Cap. 14.

An Act for continuing the Term and altering and enlarging the Powers of Two A&$, passed in the Fourth and Twenty-fifth Years of His present Majesty, for repairing and widening the Road from Beverley to Kexby Bridge > in the County of York.

[25th July 1807.]

And whereas by the said Acts no Toll can be demanded and tfiken for any Coach, Chariot, Cala(h, Chaise, Chair, or other such Carriage, drawn by Three Horses, be it therefore enacted, That, from and after the passing of this Act, there shall be demanded and taken, before any Coach, Chariot, Calalh, Chaise, Chair, or other such Carriage shall be permitted to pals through any Gate or Turnpike now erected or hereafter to be erected on the said Road or any Part thereof, such Tolls as the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, shall from Time to Time appoint, not exceeding the Sums herein-after mentioned; (that is to say,)

ANNO QUADRAGESIMO SEPTIMO

GEORGII III. REGIS.

Cap. 15-

An Act for amending, and keeping in Repair, the Road from Brampton to Longtown, in the County r of Cumberland; and for erecting a Bridge over the

Kj _ River upon the said Road.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS the Road leading from the Market Town of Brampton, through the several Parishes of Brampton, Irthing-ton, Scaleby, Kirklington, and Arthurct, to the Market Town of Longtown, in the County of Cumberland, is very much out of Repair, narrow, and incommodious for Travellers, and some Parts thereof are in so ruinous a Condition as to be unlafe for the Passage of Cattle and Carriages; and the said Road cannot be sufficiently amended, widened, altered, and kept in Repair, by the ordinary Course of Law: And whereas the said Road extends over the River Line, near to a Place called the Clift, which in Times of Flood is frequently impassable, and at other Times extremely dangerous for want of a Bridge being erected across the said River: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Confenr oi the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament act'embied, and by the Authority of the same, That Samuel Atkinson, Richard IV;Ham Batty, James Boujlead, Thomas Beil, Trustees. And be it further enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expences incident to and attending the obtaining and passing of this Act, together with lawful Interest from the Time of advancing the same to the Time of Payment, shall be paid and defrayed out of the first Monies borrowed, received, or collected by virtue of or for the Purposes of this Act, and the Remainder thereof shall from Time to Time be applied in repaying the Monies due on the Credit of the Tolls collectea on the said Road, and to grow due and to be bor. rowed on the Credit of this Act, and the Interest thereof respectively, and in carrying this Act into Execution.

LIIT. And be it further enacted, That no ASIon or Suit shall be commenced against any Person or Persons for any Thing done in pursuance of this Act until Twenty-one Days Notice shall be thereof given in Writing to the Clerk to the said Trustees, or after f ufticient Satis-faSion or Tender thereof hath been made to the Party or Parties aggrieved, orjafterSix Calendar Months next after the FaS committed; and all ASions and Suits shall be brought, laid, or tried in the County or Place where such Matters and Things respectively shall be committed and done, and not in any other County or Place; and that the Defendant or Defendants in such ASions and Suits, and every of them, may plead the General issue, and give this Act and the special Matter in Evidence at any Trial or Trials which shall be had thereupon, and that the Matter or Thing for which such ASion or ASions, Suit, or Suits, shall be so brought was done in pursuance and by the Authority of this Act; and if the said Matter or Tiling shall appear to be so dune, or if it shall appear that such ASion or Suit was brought before Twenty-one Days Notice thereof given as aforesaid, or that sufficient Satisfaction was made or tendered as aforesaid, or if any such ASion or Suit shall not be commenced within the Time before for that Purpose limited, or shall be laid in any other County or Place than as aforesaid, then the n J 4 Jury

3°7

47° GEORGII III. Sell'. 2. Cap. 15.

Jury or Juries shall find for the Defendant or Defendants therein, and if a Verdict or Verdicts shall be found for such Defendant or Defendants, or if the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs in such Action or Actions, Suit or Suits, shall become nonsuited, or suffer a Discontinuance of such Action or Actions, or if upon any Demurrer or Demurrers in such Action or Actions Judgement shall be given for the Defendant or Defendants therein, then and in either or any of the Cases aforesaid such Defendant or Defendants shall have Treble Costs, and shall have such Remedy for recovering the same as any Defendant or Defendants may have for his, her, or their Costs in any other Cases by Law.

LIV. And be it further enacted, That this Act shall be deemed and Publick Act.' taken to be a Publick Act, and shall be judicial-y taken Notice of as such by all Judges, Justices and others, without being specially pleaded.

Provided always, That for and notwithstanding any Thing in this Act or the said recited Act, or any Proceedings under the fame, all Bodies Corporate, and all and every other Person and Persons, being Owners, Occupiers, Grantees, Trustees, Feoffees, or Committees of any Lands, Tenements, Rents, or Annuities, or any Sum or Sums of Money which have been given or are liable to the amending or maintaining of any other Part or Parts of the said Roads, or any Bridge or Bridges thereon, shall remain liable and chargeable to the Repair thereof in such Manner as they were before the making of this Act, and that all the Inhabitants of the Parishes, Townships, and Places in which any Parts of the said Road lie, and all other Persons liable to perform the Work, commonly called Statute Work, upon the said Roads or any Part thereof, shall remain subject to the Performance of such Work.

XXII. Provided always, and be it further enacted, That no Toll shall be from Tolls, taken for any Carriage, Horse, Cattie, or Beast, employed in carrying or conveying, or going to carry or convey, or returning from carrying or conveying, having been employed only in carrying or conveying on the same Day, any Sand. LXI. Provided always, and be it further emitted. Cap. 19.

An Act.for reviving, continuing, and enlarging the Powers of an A<Et, of the Seventeenth of His present Majesty, for amending the Road from the South East End of Loughborough, in the County of Leicester, to Derby Bridge, near The Rujhes, and from thence to the South End of CavendiJJo Bridge, in the same County.

[25th July 1807.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Seventeenth Year of the Reign of His present Majesty King George the Third, intituled, I? g. 3.0.107; An Act for amending the Road from the South East End of the Town of Loughborough, in the County of Leicester, to Derby Bridge, near The Rulhes, and from the said Bridge to the South End of Cavendish Bridge, in the same County: And whereas the Trustees appointed in or by virtue of the said Act have proceeded to put the fame in execution, and const-derable Sums of Money have been borrowed, for the Purpose of amending and keeping in Repair the said Road, on the Credit of the Tolls di-rtfted to be taken thereon; which Money full remains due and owing, and cannot be paid off, nor can the said Road be effectually kept in Repair unless the Term of the said Act is revived and further continued, and ibme of the Powers and Provifmns thereof altered, amended, and enlarged:

May it therefore pltafe Your Majesty, that it may be enacted, and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and C.onfent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this ? q present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That therconti- ' the said recited Act, passed in the Seventeenth Year of the Reign of ITis iu'td-present Majesty, and all and every the Powers, Provisions, Directions,

Penalties, forfeitures, Clauses, Matters, and Things therein contained,

Cap. 20.

An Act for repairing and keeping in Repair several Roads in the County of Perth.

[25th july 1807.]

WHEREAS the Road leading from Locbearnbead towards Perth by Comrie, Monievaird, Strowan, Hojh Monzie, and Crieff, and the Road from Loch Tayftde, towards Dumblane by Glenlednaig,

Comrie, Glenlich-horn, Ardocb, and Kinbuck, within the County of Perth, have become, in many Places, so deep and ruinous, that Travellers can* not pass along the fame without great Inconvenience, Delay, and Danger; and it has been found, by Experience, that the Statute Labour which is applicable to the Repairs thereof is wholly inefficient to make the necessary Alterations and Repairs thereon, or to keep them in proper Condition and Repair, when so made and repaired, and for making necessary Bridges thereon: And whereas it would be greatly to the Advantage of the Public were the said Roads effectually repaired, and kept in Repair, and the necessary Bridges erected and maintained thereon: but the fame cannot be done without the Aid and Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty, That it may be enacted, and be it enacted by the King’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the Justices TruR«, of the Peace, Commissioners of Supply, and Heritors of the County of Perth, being in the actual Possession of Lands valued in the Cess Books of the said County, at One hundred Pounds Scots and upwards, of valued Rent, as also the Chief Magistrate of the City and Royal Burgh of Perth, and Royal Burgh of Culross for the Time being, shall be, and they are hereby appointed Trustees for surveying, ordering, repairing, and keeping in Repair the said Roads; and for building and keeping in Repair [Iw. fc?
